| [[Microsoft Standalone Disk BASIC-80]] (later [[Microsoft Standalone Disk BASIC-86]])!-- but not the normal "non-Standalone" Disk BASIC-80 and -86! --

| [[IBM AIX|AIX]]{{efn |name=note-11 |IBM introduced JFS with the initial release of [[IBM AIX|AIX]] Version 3.1 in 1990. This file system now called JFS1. The new JFS on which the Linux port was based was first shipped in [[OS/2 Warp]] Server for e-Business in 1999. The same sourcebase was also used for release JFS2 on AIX 5L.}}

column1: | [[International Organization for Standardization|ISO]]/[[Ecma International|ECMA]]/[[Optical Storage Technology Association|OSTA]]

column3: | [[MS-DOS 7.10]] / [[Windows 95 OSR2]]{{efn |name=note-10 |[[Microsoft]] first introduced FAT32 in [[MS-DOS 7.1]] / [[Windows 95 OSR2]] (OEM Service Release 2) and then later in [[Windows 98]]. NT-based Windows did not have ''any'' support for FAT32 up to Windows NT4; Windows 2000 was the first NT-based Windows OS that received the ability to work with it.}}
